title: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research
text: CommuteCA R package created develop standardized methods transport analysis research, particularly analysis using 2021 Census Population Statistics Canada. focused efforts Commuting Reference Guide, provides valuable variables information commuting Canadian population aged 15 older living private households. name package, CommuteCA, references commuting section 2021 Canadian Census Population. package created conjunction office Research Data Center McMaster University, Sherman Centre Digital Scholarship Mobilizing Justice. Mobilizing Justice project multidisciplinary multi-sector collaboration objective understand address transportation poverty Canada improve well-Canadians risk transport poverty. Social Sciences Humanities Research Council (SSRHC) provided funding project, created unprecedented alliance academics various Canadian provinces institutions, transportation firms, nonprofit organizations.

title: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research
text: CommuteCA consists series R datasets R Markdown files created calculate job accessibility analyses city Canada using 2021 Census Population primary data source. source data (demographic census) restricted requires controlled access, meaning must processed within Research Data Center (RDC) office. package includes datasets R Markdown files enable accessibility analysis two spatial units: Dissemination Areas, Statistics Canada spatial unit available nationwide. Census Tracts, available Census Metropolitan Areas Census Agglomerations. Census Tracts, package provides datasets R Markdown files allow researchers transport practitioners generate job accessibility measures maps without needing visit RDC office. Dissemination Areas, developed R Markdown files split process calculating analyzing accessibility metrics distinct steps. structure simplifies data processing, given restricted nature source data.

what: Explanation of the R markdown files
title: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research
text: figure shows order R Markdown files executed. Dissemination Area spatial unit, fourth fifth steps - “Calculation accessibility measures” “Visualizing accessibility measures” - must executed within RDC office working original data Census Population. make methodology easier understand, provide test dataset derived demographic census, containing selection variables. allows researchers test refine methodology processing original data RDC office. Execution order obtain accessibility analysis. R Markdown files available /data-raw folder clone repository GitHub. installed package, can access R Markdown templates RStudio navigating File > New File > R Markdown... > Template selecting one CommuteCA R Markdown templates.

title: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research
text: Considering number workers employment opportunities obtained 2021 Census Population, R markdown enables obtaining Hansen-type accessibility (Hansen, 1959) spatial availability (Soukov Paez,2023), Canadian provinces territories, considering different modes transportation. Dissemination Areas (DA), researchers must access original data within RDC office. Census Tracts (CT), package provides pre-processed datasets, allowing users generate accessibility measures without visiting RDC office.

title: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research
text: package contains series datasets accessibility analysis transportation studies. datasets include calibrated impedance functions job destinations across walking, cycling, public transit, motorized vehicle modes. functions provided three geographic levels: city, Census Metropolitan Areas (CMA) Census Agglomerations (CA) Province Territories. provinces, calibrated job impedance functions split urbanity level Indigenous Territory affiliation. package also includes land use tables labor force population job counts census tracts. code visualizes Toronto’s labour force distribution transportation mode: datasets enable census tract-level accessibility analysis. instance, job accessibility city Toronto (Hansen type): Job accessibility city Toronto (Hansen-type). job spatial availability city Toronto. Job accessibility city Toronto (Soukhov-type, spatial availability).
code: library('dplyr') #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union data("pr_impedance_functions") # Load provincial impedance functions  pr_impedance_functions %>%    filter(Pr == 'Alberta') %>% # Filter for Alberta   select(Pr, CMA_type, PwMode, distribution, est_1, est_2) # Display key columns #> # A tibble: 19 × 6 #>    Pr      CMA_type                           PwMode distribution  est_1   est_2 #>    <chr>   <chr>                              <chr>  <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 Alberta CMA/CA                             Car/m… lnorm        2.85    0.689  #>  2 Alberta CMA/CA                             Trans… gamma        2.89    0.0684 #>  3 Alberta CMA/CA                             Walk   exp          0.0753  0      #>  4 Alberta CMA/CA                             Bike   gamma        2.27    0.106  #>  5 Alberta Moderate metropolitan influenced … Car/m… lnorm        2.78    0.863  #>  6 Alberta Moderate metropolitan influenced … Walk   lnorm        1.61    1.05   #>  7 Alberta Moderate metropolitan influenced … Trans… gamma        1.54    0.0381 #>  8 Alberta Moderate metropolitan influenced … Bike   lnorm        2.07    0.794  #>  9 Alberta Weak metropolitan influenced zone  Car/m… lnorm        2.46    0.975  #> 10 Alberta Weak metropolitan influenced zone  Walk   lnorm        1.82    0.964  #> 11 Alberta Weak metropolitan influenced zone  Bike   lnorm        2.01    0.808  #> 12 Alberta Weak metropolitan influenced zone  Trans… gamma        1.25    0.0235 #> 13 Alberta Strong metropolitan influenced zo… Car/m… gamma        1.39    0.0500 #> 14 Alberta Strong metropolitan influenced zo… Walk   lnorm        1.06    1.29   #> 15 Alberta Strong metropolitan influenced zo… Bike   unif         0      35.1    #> 16 Alberta Strong metropolitan influenced zo… Trans… exp          0.0264  0      #> 17 Alberta No metropolitan influenced zone    Car/m… exp          0.0470  0      #> 18 Alberta No metropolitan influenced zone    Walk   lnorm        1.39    0.790  #> 19 Alberta No metropolitan influenced zone    Trans… gamma        3.25    0.0802 library("CommuteCA2") library("sf") #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.2, GDAL 3.9.1, PROJ 9.4.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library("tmap")  #data("census_tracts_ca21") # Census Tract Geometries #data("census_divisions_ca21") # Census Division geometries data("land_use_CT_mode") # Land Use data with information of labour force and number of jobs considering transportation modes  #census_tracts_ca21 <- census_tracts_ca21 %>%  #  filter(PCD == 3520) # Filtering data for the city of Toronto   #land_use_CT_mode <- land_use_CT_mode %>%  #  filter(PCD == 3520) %>% # Filtering data for the city of Toronto  #  select(CTUID, PwMode, labour_force_est_rounded, jobs_rounded)  # Joining both data sets #Toronto <- expand.grid(CTUID = unique(census_tracts_ca21$CTUID),  #              PwMode = unique(land_use_CT_mode$PwMode)) %>% #  left_join(land_use_CT_mode, by = c("CTUID" = "CTUID", "PwMode" = "PwMode")) %>% #  left_join(census_tracts_ca21, by = "CTUID")  #Toronto <- st_as_sf(Toronto, crs = st_crs(census_tracts_ca21)) # transforming the table in a spatial data type  # Creating the plot #total_pop_by_mode_CT <- tm_shape(Toronto) +  #   tm_polygons("labour_force_est_rounded", #              style = "cont", #              palette = "Reds", #              title = " ", #              border.col = NULL) +   #   tm_facets(by = "PwMode") +        #   tm_scale_bar(position = c("right", "bottom")) + #   tm_compass(position = c("left", "top"), size = 1.0) +  #   tm_shape(census_divisions_ca21) + #   tm_borders("black", lwd=0.5)  # Visualizing #total_pop_by_mode_CT

title: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research
text: can install development version CommuteCA :

what: CommuteCA2: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research — CommuteCA2-package
title: CommuteCA2: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research — CommuteCA2-package
text: main objective *CommuteCA* package develop standardized methods accessibility analysis research, especially studies using Statistics Canada surveys. Among available surveys, focused efforts 2021 Census Population, contain valuable variables transportation research. package created support office Research Data Center McMaster University, Sherman Centre Digital Scholarship Mobilizing Justice.

title: CommuteCA2: Standardized Methods for Accessibility Analysis in Canadian Research — CommuteCA2-package
text: Maintainer: Bruno Dos Santos dossanb@mcmaster.ca (ORCID) Authors: Antonio Paez paezha@mcmaster.ca (ORCID)

what: 2021 Census of Population Test Data — census_test_data
title: 2021 Census of Population Test Data — census_test_data
text: object contains test data (fake observations created represent original version) Census Population.

title: 2021 Census of Population Test Data — census_test_data
2021 Census of Population Test Data — census_test_data
text: data frame object containing 20,000 rows 17 variables; row represents unique (fake) respondent. Frame_ID Unique identifier (fake) respondent. PRCDDA Refers dissemination area (DA) current residence Pr Refers province territory current residence. CMA Census metropolitan area census agglomeration current residence. PCD Census division current residence. CompW1 Weight households dwellings universes. LBR_FORC variable refers whether person employed, unemployed labour force. CfInc Total income census family (sum total incomes members family). CFCNT Census family size (numbers persons). CF_PnCF_NumEarners Number earners census family. PWDA Place work dissemination area. PWPR Place work province. PWCD Census metropolitan area census agglomeration place work. PWCMA Place work census division. PWDUR Commuting duration, refers length time, minutes, usually required person travel place work. PWDist Distance (straight-line) home work. PwMode Main mode commuting' refers main mode transportation person uses travel place work.

what: Impedance functions for Census Metropolitan Areas and Census Agglomerations — cma_impedance_functions
title: Impedance functions for Census Metropolitan Areas and Census Agglomerations — cma_impedance_functions
text: object contains impedance functions Census Metropolitan Areas Census Agglomerations (CMA/CAs), job destinations, considering different transportation modes ('Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk'). estimated impedance functions  using fitdistrplus package, using 'PwDUR' (Commuting duration) 2021 Census Population. best-fit function defined selecting lowest Akaike information criterion.

title: Impedance functions for Census Metropolitan Areas and Census Agglomerations — cma_impedance_functions
Impedance functions for Census Metropolitan Areas and Census Agglomerations — cma_impedance_functions
text: data frame containing 675 rows 12 variables; row represents unique function. CMA Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration unique identifier. Pr Province Territory. PwMode Transportation mode. Possible values: 'Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk.' distribution Name function best adjusted duration values considering specific location transportation mode (can "exponential", "norm", “lnorm”, “gamma” “unif”) est_1 Estimate first parameter function described 'distribution.' est_2 Estimate second parameter function described 'distribution.' loglike Log-Likelihood obtained function 'distribution.' AIC Akaike information criterion obtained function 'distribution.' BIC Bayesian information criterion obtained function 'distribution.'

title: Impedance functions for Census Metropolitan Areas and Census Agglomerations — cma_impedance_functions
text: "2021 Census Population, informations census available accessed December 19th 2024.

what: Maximum travel times in the Census Metropolitan Area. — cma_max_travel_times
title: Maximum travel times in the Census Metropolitan Area. — cma_max_travel_times
text: object contains maximum travel times commuting work Census Metropolitan Area (CMA) Canada, obtained Census Population (2021). methodology obtain data set described R markdown 'making-data-v2.Rmd'.

title: Maximum travel times in the Census Metropolitan Area. — cma_max_travel_times
Maximum travel times in the Census Metropolitan Area. — cma_max_travel_times
text: simple feature class (sf) polygon object containing 596 rows 3 variables; row represents combination CMA transportation mode. CMA Uniquely identifies CMA. PwMode Transportation mode. Possible values: 'Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk.' Max_time_value Maximum travel time CMA using mentioned transportation mode.

title: Maximum travel times in the Census Metropolitan Area. — cma_max_travel_times
text: "Census Population 2021 accessed September 11, 2024.

title: Census Tract Land Use (General) — land_use_CT_general
text: object contains census tracts (CT) census metropolitan areas census agglomerations (2021), land use information regarding number labour force number jobs CT. CTs small, relatively stable geographic areas usually population fewer 7,500 persons, based data previous Census Population Program. located census metropolitan areas (CMAs) census agglomerations (CAs) core population 50,000 previous census. labour force number jobs CT obtained Census Population. calculated labour force summing number employed people number unemployed individuals still part workforce. done summing weights census variable (CompW1). number jobs obtained applying weighted sum cases respondents mentioning working DA.  cases CT accordance Research Data Centre vetting rules released. methodology obtain data set described R markdown 'making-data-v2.Rmd'.

title: Census Tract Land Use (General) — land_use_CT_general
Census Tract Land Use (General) — land_use_CT_general
text: data frame containing 6,148 rows 8 variables; row represents unique CT. CTUID Uniquely identifies census tract. CT assigned seven‑character numeric "name" (including leading zeros, decimal point trailing zeros). CTNAME Census tract name. CMAUID Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration unique identifier. CMANAME Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration name. PCD Uniquely identifies census division. PRUID Uniquely identifies province territory. labour_force_rounded Number individuals labour force (employed ), rounded nearest multiple 5. jobs_rounded Number jobs CT rounded nearest multiple 5.

title: Census Tract Land Use (General) — land_use_CT_general
text: "2021 census tracts areas files created Canadian Census available accessed May 6th 2024. variable definitions based definitions included census year 2021 boundary file reference guide (Boundary Files, Reference Guide, Second edition, 2021 Census. Statistics Canada Catalogue . 92-160-G.).

what: Census Tract Land Use (by Mode) — land_use_CT_mode
title: Census Tract Land Use (by Mode) — land_use_CT_mode
text: object contains census tracts (CT) census metropolitan areas census agglomerations (2021), land use information regarding number labour force (estimated) number jobs CT. CTs small, relatively stable geographic areas usually population fewer 7,500 persons, based data previous Census Population Program. located census metropolitan areas (CMAs) census agglomerations (CAs) core population 50,000 previous census. labour force number jobs CT obtained Census Population. estimated labour force calculating proportion trips made mode transport census tract, distributing non-commuters (people either work work home) among transport modes. number jobs obtained applying weighted sum cases respondents mentioning working DA.  cases CT accordance Research Data Centre vetting rules released. methodology obtain data set described R markdown 'making-data-v2.Rmd'.

title: Census Tract Land Use (by Mode) — land_use_CT_mode
Census Tract Land Use (by Mode) — land_use_CT_mode
text: data frame containing 23,970 rows 9 variables; row represents unique CT. CTUID Uniquely identifies census tract. CT assigned seven‑character numeric "name" (including leading zeros, decimal point trailing zeros). CTNAME Census tract name. CMAUID Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration unique identifier. CMANAME Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration name. PCD Uniquely identifies census division. PRUID Uniquely identifies province territory. PwMode Transportation mode. Possible values: 'Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk.' labour_force_est_rounded Estimated number individuals labour force (employed ), rounded nearest multiple 5. jobs_rounded Number jobs CT rounded nearest multiple 5.

title: Census Tract Land Use (by Mode) — land_use_CT_mode
text: "2021 census tracts areas files created Canadian Census available accessed May 6th 2024. variable definitions based definitions included census year 2021 boundary file reference guide (Boundary Files, Reference Guide, Second edition, 2021 Census. Statistics Canada Catalogue . 92-160-G.).

what: Impedance functions for Canadian Census Divisions — pcd_impedance_functions
title: Impedance functions for Canadian Census Divisions — pcd_impedance_functions
text: object contains impedance functions Canadian Census Divisions (CDs) job destinations, considering different transportation modes ('Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk'). estimated impedance functions  using fitdistrplus package, using 'PwDUR' (Commuting duration) 2021 Census Population. best-fit function defined selecting lowest Akaike information criterion.

title: Impedance functions for Canadian Census Divisions — pcd_impedance_functions
Impedance functions for Canadian Census Divisions — pcd_impedance_functions
text: data frame containing 675 rows 12 variables; row represents unique function. PCD Uniquely identifies census division. Pr Province Territory. CMA Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration unique identifier. PwMode Transportation mode. Possible values: 'Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk.' distribution Name function best adjusted duration values considering specific location transportation mode (can "exponential", "norm", “lnorm”, “gamma” “unif”) est_1 Estimate first parameter function described 'distribution.' est_2 Estimate second parameter function described 'distribution.' loglike Log-Likelihood obtained function 'distribution.' AIC Akaike information criterion obtained function 'distribution.' BIC Bayesian information criterion obtained function 'distribution.'

title: Maximum travel times in the Census Division. — pcd_max_travel_times
Maximum travel times in the Census Division. — pcd_max_travel_times
text: simple feature class (sf) polygon object containing 1,083 rows 3 variables; row represents combination CD transportation mode. PCD Uniquely identifies census division (composed 2-digit province territory unique identifier followed 2-digit census division code). PwMode Transportation mode. Possible values: 'Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk.' Max_time_value Maximum travel time CD using mentioned transportation mode.

what: Impedance functions for Canadian Provinces and Territories — pr_impedance_functions
title: Impedance functions for Canadian Provinces and Territories — pr_impedance_functions
text: object contains impedance functions Canadian Provinces Territories, job destinations, considering different transportation modes ('Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk') types CMA/CAs ('Territories (outside CAs)','CMA/CA','Strong metropolitan influenced zone', 'Moderate metropolitan influenced zone','Weak metropolitan influenced zone', 'metropolitan influenced zone'). estimated impedance functions  using fitdistrplus package, using 'PwDUR' (Commuting duration) 2021 Census Population. best-fit function defined selecting lowest Akaike information criterion.

title: Impedance functions for Canadian Provinces and Territories — pr_impedance_functions
Impedance functions for Canadian Provinces and Territories — pr_impedance_functions
text: data frame containing 675 rows 12 variables; row represents unique function. Pr Province Territory. CMA_type Type Census Metropolitan Area Census Agglomeration (Possible values: 'Territories (outside CAs)','CMA/CA','Strong metropolitan influenced zone', 'Moderate metropolitan influenced zone','Weak metropolitan influenced zone', 'metropolitan influenced zone'). PwMode Transportation mode. Possible values: 'Bike', 'Car', 'Transit', 'Walk.' distribution Name function best adjusted duration values considering specific location transportation mode (can "exponential", "norm", “lnorm”, “gamma” “unif”) est_1 Estimate first parameter function described 'distribution.' est_2 Estimate second parameter function described 'distribution.' loglike Log-Likelihood obtained function 'distribution.' AIC Akaike information criterion obtained function 'distribution.' BIC Bayesian information criterion obtained function 'distribution.'
